explanation: [0-0] A young man wearing a pink sweatshirt, black sweatpants, and a yellow backpack stands in the hall of a library. He stands excitedly in front of a giant cylindrical book tower made of stacked books, his hands clenched into fists in front of his chest. The book tower has an arched opening in the front, revealing a warm orange-yellow light inside. Above the image is a line of white Spanish text: "Sabías que existe una torre infinita de libros".

[0-5] Then, the man talks while gesturing with both hands, backing away. He eventually arrives at the arched opening of the book tower, rests his right hand on the tower, leans into the gap inside the tower for a second, looks back in surprise, motions for the camera to come closer, and moves to the right to clear the view.

[5-8] Immediately afterward, the camera switches to the perspective from inside the book tower, looking down. Countless books can be seen stacked layer upon layer, forming a bottomless book hole.

[8-14] After a short pause, the camera pans upward. Inside the book tower, books are stacked layer upon layer, forming a circular passage or wall, and a vanishing point can be seen in the distance. Finally, as the camera continues to move upward, two lines of white text appear one after another at the top of the screen: "Se encuentra en la Biblioteca Municipal..." and "en Praga". There is a red balloon icon to the right of "en Praga".
